> The default p=
oliteness settings are running on hostname-level.
> The level to apply thes=
e settings on is defined in the so called QueueAssignmentPolicy
> 
> So - t=
o obtain a greater speed on a single host you need another QueueAssignmentP=
olicy that does not put URLs in queues based on the hostname
> 
> For this =
use can use:
> org.archive.crawler.frontier.BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy
> 
=
> This one distributes URLs in a greater number of queues based on a hash o=
f the URL I think. Be aware that this will put the load on a single host qu=
ite high. The only parameter you can then control in practise is the overal=
l speed-limits.
>
